title: NASA backtracks on VIPER commercial partnership
summary:
NASA has canceled plans to find a commercial partner to launch a robotic lunar rover and will instead pursue “alternative approaches” to fly the mission.
The post NASA backtracks on VIPER commercial partnership appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Commercial competition and cooperation at the moon
summary:

The post Commercial competition and cooperation at the moon appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Proba-3 achieves precise formation flying
summary: For the first time, two spacecraft in orbit were aligned in formation with millimetre precision and maintained their relative position for several hours without any control from the ground.

title: Plato grows its many eyes
summary: The activities to assemble the European Space Agency’s Plato mission are progressing well now that 24 of the spacecraft’s 26 cameras have been installed. Once in space, Plato will use its many eyes to survey a very large area of the sky and hunt for terrestrial planets. The spacecraft’s supporting element is also coming together in parallel.

title: Vega-C liftoff in slow-mo
summary: ESA’s state-of-the-art Biomass satellite launched aboard a Vega-C rocket from Europe’s Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana. The rocket lifted off on 29 April 2025 at 11:15 CEST (06:15 local time).

title: Antarctic glacier caught stealing ice from neighbour
summary: Thanks largely to Copernicus Sentinel-1, scientists have discovered that a glacier in Antarctica is rapidly siphoning ice from neighbouring flows – at a pace never before seen. Until now, researchers believed that this process of ‘ice piracy’ in Antarctica took hundreds or even thousands of years, but these latest findings clearly demonstrate that this isn’t always the case.

title: NASA Still Looking for A Way to Get VIPER to the Moon
summary: NASA is still looking for ideas of how to get the VIPER rover to the Moon. The rover is already built, but the agency canceled plans to use a commercial […]

title: White House taps former Air Force colonel for NASA Deputy Administrator role
summary: President Donald Trump sent the nomination of Matthew Anderson to the U.S. Senate Committee on Commerce, Science and Transportation on May 6, but it was announced by the Space Force Association where Anderson serves as the Chief Growth Officer.

title: Leshin to step down as JPL director
summary:
The director of NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory is leaving after three years on the job and will be replaced by a longtime lab official.
The post Leshin to step down as JPL director appeared first on SpaceNews.
